main event: A witness observed a pulsating light above and to the left while driving north on U.S. 1 near Mims, Florida in the early morning hours of March 20, 1965.
interesting points: The object remained motionless for a moment with the lights varying rapidly in color from almost white to an intense blue.
The witness estimated the altitude of the object to be between 5,000 and 6,000 feet.
The object descended several times in succession, lowering itself approximately 500 feet and stopping for half a minute or more before descending again.
The object hesitated for about a minute and a half at an altitude of 1,000 to 1,500 feet, then accelerated very rapidly in a northerly direction and completely vanished in 3 to 5 seconds.
The witness was a 48-year-old trained pilot in good physical health with good eyesight, and was not easily excited or prone to hallucinations.
sighted object: a pulsating light in the sky
